frame.name: Vehicle
frame.definition: <def-root>The frame concerns the vehicles that human beings use for the purpose of transportation.</def-root>

FE.name: Descriptor
FE.definition: <def-root>This FE identifies a characteristic or description of the Vehicle. <ex>Kim drove a <fex name="Desc"> used</fex> <t>car</t>.</ex></def-root>

FE.name: Vehicle
FE.definition: <def-root>Vehicle is the transportation device that the human beings use to travel. <ex>To get to the island, you need to take a <fex name="Vehicle"><t>ferry</t></fex>.</ex></def-root>

FE.name: Possessor
FE.definition: <def-root>This Frame Element denotes the <fen>Possessor</fen> of the <fen>Vehicle</fen>. <ex><fex name="Poss">His</fex> <t>car</t> crashed into a tree</ex>.</def-root>

FE.name: Itinerary
FE.definition: <def-root>The frame element tells about the time and route of the service of the transportation device. <ex>You must take the <fex name="Itinerary">midnight</fex> <t>train</t> to get there by tomorrow noon.</ex></def-root>

FE.name: Means_of_propulsion
FE.definition: <def-root>The <fen>Means_of_propulsion</fen> designates how the vehicle is moved. <ex> They rode in a <fex name="Means_of_propulsion">horse-drawn</fex> <t>carriage</t>. </ex> </def-root>

FE.name: Use
FE.definition: <def-root>The task which the <fen>Vehicle</fen> is put to. Normally, this includes the transportation of some kind.</def-root>

lexUnit.name: car.n
lexUnit.definition: COD: a powered road vehicle designed to carry a small number of people

lexUnit.name: bus.n
lexUnit.definition: COD: a large motor vehicle carrying paying passengers on a fixed route

lexUnit.name: truck.n
lexUnit.definition: COD: a large road vehicle, used for carrying goods, materials, or troops.

lexUnit.name: bike.n
lexUnit.definition: COD: a bicycle or motorcycle.

lexUnit.name: taxi.n
lexUnit.definition: COD: motor vehicle licensed to transport passengers in return for payment of a fare.

lexUnit.name: plane.n
lexUnit.definition: COD: a powered flying vehicle with fixed wings and a weight greater than that of the air it displaces.

lexUnit.name: ferry.n
lexUnit.definition: COD: a boat or ship for conveying passengers and goods, especially as a regular service.

lexUnit.name: boat.n
lexUnit.definition: COD: a small vessel propelled by oars, sails, or an engine.

lexUnit.name: bicycle.n
lexUnit.definition: COD: a vehicle consisting of two wheels held in a frame one behind the other, propelled by pedals and steered with handlebars attached to the front wheel.

lexUnit.name: ship.n
lexUnit.definition: COD: a large seagoing boat.

lexUnit.name: tram.n
lexUnit.definition: COD: a passenger vehicle powered by electricity conveyed by overhead cables, and running on rails laid in a public road.

lexUnit.name: automobile.n
lexUnit.definition: COD: a motor car.

lexUnit.name: tricycle.n
lexUnit.definition: COD: a vehicle similar to a bicycle, but having three wheels, two at the back and one at the front. or a three-wheeled motor vehicle for a disabled driver.

lexUnit.name: aeroplane.n
lexUnit.definition: COD: a powered flying vehicle with fixed wings and a weight greater than that of the air it displaces.

lexUnit.name: scooter.n
lexUnit.definition: COD: a light two-wheeled motorcycle.

lexUnit.name: schooner.n
lexUnit.definition: COD: a sailing ship with two or more masts, typically with the foremast smaller than the mainmast.

lexUnit.name: train.n
lexUnit.definition: COD: a series of railway carriages or wagons moved as a unit by a locomotive or by integral motors.

lexUnit.name: carriage.n
lexUnit.definition: COD: a four-wheeled passenger vehicle pulled by two or more horses.

lexUnit.name: cab.n
lexUnit.definition: COD: a taxi.

lexUnit.name: coach.n
lexUnit.definition: COD: a comfortably equipped single-decker bus used for longer journeys.

lexUnit.name: vehicle.n
lexUnit.definition: COD: a thing used for transporting people or goods on land, e.g. a car, truck, or cart.

lexUnit.name: lorry.n
lexUnit.definition: COD: a large, heavy motor vehicle for transporting goods or troops.

lexUnit.name: submarine.n
lexUnit.definition: COD: a streamlined warship designed to operate completely submerged in the sea for long periods.

lexUnit.name: tank.n
lexUnit.definition: COD: a heavy armoured fighting vehicle carrying guns and moving on a continuous articulated metal track.

lexUnit.name: cart.n
lexUnit.definition: COD: a light two-wheeled open vehicle for driving in, pulled by a single horse.

lexUnit.name: toboggan.n
lexUnit.definition: COD: a light, narrow vehicle, typically on runners, used for sliding downhill over snow or ice.

lexUnit.name: pick-up.n
lexUnit.definition: COD: a small van or truck with low sides.

lexUnit.name: van.n
lexUnit.definition: COD: a covered motor vehicle used for transporting goods or people

lexUnit.name: limousine.n
lexUnit.definition: COD: a large, luxurious car, typically with a partition behind the driver.

lexUnit.name: convertible.n
lexUnit.definition: COD: a convertible car.

lexUnit.name: helicopter.n
lexUnit.definition: COD: a type of aircraft deriving both lift and propulsion from one or two sets of horizontally revolving rotors and capable of moving vertically and horizontally.

lexUnit.name: canoe.n
lexUnit.definition: COD: a narrow keelless boat with pointed ends, propelled with a paddle.

lexUnit.name: kayak.n
lexUnit.definition: COD: a canoe of a type used originally by the Inuit, made of a light frame with a watertight covering having a small opening for the seat.

lexUnit.name: buggy.n
lexUnit.definition: COD: a small motor vehicle with an open top.

lexUnit.name: liner.n
lexUnit.definition: COD: a large passenger ship of a type formerly used on a regular line.

lexUnit.name: sedan.n
lexUnit.definition: COD: a motor car for four or more people.

lexUnit.name: vessel.n
lexUnit.definition: COD: a ship or large boat.

lexUnit.name: tank car.n
lexUnit.definition: FN: a car of a freight train which is designed to hold liquids.

lexUnit.name: warplane.n
lexUnit.definition: FN: a plane used in war

lexUnit.name: yacht.n
lexUnit.definition: COD: a boat with sails and sometimes an engine, used for either racing or travelling on for pleasure:
